file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 22-11-03-04 - AILERON SERVO - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AILERON SERVO - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the aileron autopilot servo of the Automatic Flight-Control System and its support. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - REMOV- ALL 22-11-03-000-801-A AL AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - INSTAL- ALL 22-11-03-400-801-A LATION SUPPORT OF THE AILERON AUTOPILOT ALL 22-11-03-000-802-A SERVO - REMOVAL SUPPORT OF THE AILERON AUTOPILOT ALL 22-11-03-400-802-A SERVO - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 22-11-03 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 22-11-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the aileron autopilot servo of the Automatic Flight-Control System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the AP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (2) Remove access door 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Cut the lockwires. (2) Remove the screw (1) and washers (2) (4 positions) that attach the aileron autopilot servo (4) to the support (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 22-11-03 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (5). (4) Remove the aileron autopilot servo (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 22-11-03 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Aileron Autopilot Servo - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 123 DET. A LOCKWIRE (REF.) 2. WASHER (4) 1. SCREW (4) 3. SUPPORT 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 4. AUTOPILOT SERVO DET. B 145AMM220001.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 22-11-03 Page 4 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 22-11-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the aileron autopilot servo of the Automatic Flight-Control System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 22-11-00-700-803-A/500 AUTOPILOT - FUNCTIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C20 Lockwire AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (5) to the aileron autopilot servo (4). (2) Put the aileron autopilot servo (4) on the support (3). (3) Install the screw (1) and washers (2) (4 positions) to attach the aileron autopilot servo (4) to the support (3). (4) Safety the screw (1) with lockwire. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 22-11-03 Page 5 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the AP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do the Autopilot-Functional Test ( AMM TASK 22-11-00-700-803-A/500). (3) Install access door 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 22-11-03 Page 6 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 22-11-03-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. SUPPORT OF THE AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the support of the aileron autopilot servo of the Automatic Flight-Control System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 22-11-03-000-801-A/400 AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - REMOVAL IPC 27-11-00 AILERON PRIMARY MECHANICAL CONTROL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Locking clips IPC 27-11-00 4 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Remove the aileron autopilot servo (AMM TASK 22-11-03-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove locking clips (4) and (6) from the turnbuckle (3) and (5) and discard them. (2) Loosen the turnbuckles (3) and (5) to disconnect the control cables (2) and (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 22-11-03 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the bolts (8) and washers (9) (4 positions) that attach the support (1) of the aileron autopilot servo to the support (10) at the fuselage structure. (4) Remove the support (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 22-11-03 Page 8 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Support of the Aileron Autopilot Servo - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONE 123 10. SUPPORT DET. A (FUSELAGE STRUCTURE) 1. SUPPORT 9. WASHER (4) DET. B 8. BOLT (4) 7. CONTROL CABLE 2. CONTROL CABLE 3. TURNBUCKLE 6. LOCKING CLIPS 5. TURNBUCKLE 4. LOCKING CLIPS EM145AMM220022B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 22-11-03 Page 9 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 22-11-03-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. SUPPORT OF THE AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the support of the aileron autopilot servo of the Automatic Flight-Control System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 22-11-03-400-801-A/400 AILERON AUTOPILOT SERVO - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 27-11-01-700-802-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Put the support (1) of the aileron autopilot servo on the support (10) at the fuselage structure. (2) Install the bolts (8) and washers (9) (4 positions) to attach the support (1) of the aileron autopilot servo to the support (10) at the fuselage structure. (3) Connect the control cables (2) and (7) through the turnbuckles (3) and (5). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Install the aileron autopilot servo (AMM TASK 22-11-03-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 22-11-03 Page 10 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Apply tension to the control cables (AMM TASK 27-11-01-700-802-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 22-11-03 Page 11 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
